definition: failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
to apply (paint etc)/to smear/to daub/to blot out/to scribble/to scrawl/(literary) mud/street
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]

sentences.english: After the first round, my team was skunked by the competition.
sentences.chinese: 第一輪後，我的小組一敗塗地。

sentences.english: But after the father embezzles sentences, I arrogant collapse completely.
sentences.chinese: 可是父親貪污被判刑後，我的驕傲就一敗塗地。

sentences.english: I don’t want to risk losing a contest in violence.
sentences.chinese: 我可不想在一場暴力對決中輸得一敗塗地。

sentences.english: His first performance was a debacle: the audience booed him off the stage.
sentences.chinese: 一敗塗地，觀衆發出噓聲把他轟下了臺。

sentences.english: With all the cards on the table, Lando realized that he was set up to lose.
sentences.chinese: 現在所有的牌都攤開了，蘭多意識到他將一敗塗地。

sentences.english: Do you ver feel like breaking down?
sentences.chinese: 你曾經覺得自己一敗塗地嗎？

sentences.english: Losing an election does not have to mean losing our way.
sentences.chinese: 選舉上一時的失敗並不意味著我們從此就一敗塗地了。

sentences.english: Yelling at your mom may get you in worse trouble or even grounded.
sentences.chinese: 對媽媽大喊大叫會讓你深陷困境或者一敗塗地。

sentences.english: This afternoon the New York Giants mopped the floor with the Washington Redskins.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午紐約巨人隊把華盛頓紅人隊打得一敗塗地。

sentences.english: I reserved foreshadowing, suffer a big.
sentences.chinese: 我預留的伏筆，一敗塗地。

sentences.english: Our team got clobbered on Saturday.
sentences.chinese: 我們隊星期六一敗塗地。

sentences.english: If I lose heart, I will be a penniless failure.
sentences.chinese: 如果連心都丟了，我將會是一敗塗地。

sentences.english: Our football team was clobbered in last night's game.
sentences.chinese: 我們的足球隊在昨晚的比賽中一敗塗地。

definition: to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
to boss people around (idiom)
chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
proud and arrogant
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
bold, visionary words
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
willingly and gladly (idiom)
to walk right into the trap
sb or sth detested by all/target of scorn/anathema/cf. 老鼠過街，人人喊打|老鼠过街，人人喊打[lao3 shu3 guo4 jie1 , ren2 ren2 han3 da3]
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
lit. to be confined within a circle drawn on the ground (idiom)/fig. to confine oneself to a restricted range of activities
